response:
Of course! I'm happy to play along. Here are my responses:

Picturesque - Regular ed student: The sunset was so picturesque, I couldn't help but take a dozen photos.

Calmness - English language learner: The calmness of the ocean was a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of city life.

Affection - Regular ed student: My wife always showers me with affection, it makes me feel so loved and appreciated.

Tasty - English language learner: This food is so tasty, I could eat it every day!

Brightness - Regular ed student: The brightness of the sun on a clear day is incredible, it's like a breath of fresh air.

Cheerfulness - English language learner: Her cheerfulness was infectious, it made everyone around her feel happier and more positive.

Battle - Regular ed student: The battle we fought together was intense, but in the end, we emerged victorious.

Sickness - English language learner: I've been feeling so sick lately, I hope it passes soon.

Death-wish - Regular ed student: I never wanted to cause anyone harm, my death-wish was just a cry for help.

Rage - English language learner: The rage that built up inside me after the argument was overwhelming, I needed to find a way to release it.

Explosion - Regular ed student: The explosion of emotion when we finally found out the good news was incredible, it was like a weight had been lifted off our shoulders.

Demise - English language learner: The demise of the company was a shock, no one saw it coming.
